text:
Reducing job completion
time for compute-intensive,

tightly coupled HPC workloads
can be challenging and costly.

That’s why HPC-optimized Amazon EC2
Hpc7a instances
powered by 4th gen AMD EPYC™ processors

are designed for
tightly coupled, compute-intensive,

high-performance computing (HPC) workloads to
deliver cost-efficient performance at scale.

Hpc7a instances are ideal for computational
fluid dynamics (CFD) workloads,
weather forecasting,
and multi-physics simulations.

Hpc7a instances feature 2x higher core
density,
up to 192 cores,
2.1x higher memory bandwidth throughput,
2x memory capacity at 768GB,
and 3x higher network bandwidth,
at 300 Gbps,

than previous
generation Amazon EC2 Hpc6a instances.
And Hpc7a comes with size options
to help you manage costs for your workloads.

Hpc7a instances offer exceptional
performance with high-throughput,

low latency, low jitter Elastic Fabric Adapter
(EFA), which is based on the AWS Nitro System.

Together, these capabilities
enable you to scale  faster

and reduce time-to-insight for your
tightly coupled HPC workloads

delivering better price performance compared
to previous generation instances.

AWS ParallelCluster makes it easy
to deploy HPC clusters

using a simple graphical user interface
or text file to provision resources.
Use Amazon FSx for Lustre,
a high performance  file system
with sub-millisecond latencies,
and run your workloads using Hpc7a instances.
Get started today with Amazon EC2 Hpc7a instances.
powered by 4th gen AMD EPYC™ processors.
